pageContent: English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (Part 45)

Credits English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (45 Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa) by Dr. Sant Singh Khalsa Downloaded in HTML format from www.gurbanifiles.com Converted by webmaster@ishwar.com For more sacred texts, please visit: www.ishwar.com 1

Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 001 1429 : 1 I had looked upon the world as my own, but no one belongs to anyone else. 1429 : 2 O Nanak, only devotional worship of the Lord is permanent; enshrine this in your mind. ||48|| 1429 : 3 The world and its affairs are totally false; know this well, my friend. 1429 : 4 Says Nanak, it is like a wall of sand; it shall not endure. ||49|| 1429 : 5 Raam Chand passed away, as did Raawan, even though he had lots of relatives. 1429 : 6 Says Nanak, nothing lasts forever; the world is like a dream. ||50|| 1429 : 7 People become anxious, when something unexpected happens. 1429 : 8 This is the way of the world, O Nanak; nothing is stable or permanent. ||51|| 1429 : 9 Whatever has been created shall be destroyed; everyone shall perish, today or tomorrow. 2

1429 : 10 O Nanak, sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, and give up all other entanglements. ||52|| 1429 : 11 DOHRAA: 1429 : 12 My strength is exhausted, and I am in bondage; I cannot do anything at all. 1429 : 13 Says Nanak, now, the Lord is my Support; He will help me, as He did the elephant. ||53|| 1429 : 14 My strength has been restored, and my bonds have been broken; now, I can do everything. 1429 : 15 Nanak: everything is in Your hands, Lord; You are my Helper and Support. ||54|| 1429 : 16 My associates and companions have all deserted me; no one remains with me. 1429 : 17 Says Nanak, in this tragedy, the Lord alone is my Support. ||55|| 1429 : 18 The Naam remains; the Holy Saints remain; the Guru, the Lord of the Universe, remains. 1429 : 19 Says Nanak, how rare are those who chant the Guru's Mantra in this world. ||56|| Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 001 3

1429 : 20 I have enshrined the Lord's Name within my heart; there is nothing equal to it. 1429 : 21 Meditating in remembrance on it, my troubles are taken away; I have received the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan. ||57||1|| 1429 : 22 Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl: 1429 : 23 Upon this Plate, three things have been placed: Truth, Contentment and Contemplation. 1429 : 24 The Ambrosial Nectar of the Naam, the Name of our Lord and Master, has been placed upon it as well; it is the Support of all. 1429 : 25 One who eats it and enjoys it shall be saved. 1429 : 26 This thing can never be forsaken; keep this always and forever in your mind. 1429 : 27 The dark world−ocean is crossed over, by grasping the Feet of the Lord; O Nanak, it is all the extension of God. ||1|| 1429 : 28 Shalok, Fifth Mehl: 1429 : 29 Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 001 4

I have not appreciated what You have done for me, Lord; only You can make me worthy. 1429 : 30 I am unworthy − I have no worth or virtues at all. You have taken pity on me. 1429 : 31 You took pity on me, and blessed me with Your Mercy, and I have met the True Guru, my Friend. 1429 : 32 O Nanak, if I am blessed with the Naam, I live, and my body and mind blossom forth. ||1|| 1429 : 33 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1429 : 34 Raag Maalaa: 1429 : 35 Each Raga has five wives, 1429 : 36 and eight sons, who emit distinctive notes. 1429 : 37 In the first place is Raag Bhairao. −− Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 001 −− Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 001 5

Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 002 1430 : 38 It is accompanied by the voices of its five Raaginis: 1430 : 39 First come Bhairavee, and Bilaavalee; 1430 : 40 then the songs of Punni−aakee and Bangalee; 1430 : 41 and then Asalaykhee. 1430 : 42 These are the five consorts of Bhairao. 1430 : 43 The sounds of Pancham, Harakh and Disaakh; 1430 : 44 the songs of Bangaalam, Madh and Maadhav. ||1|| 1430 : 45 Lalat and Bilaaval − each gives out its own melody. 1430 : 46 when these eight sons of Bhairao are sung by accomplished musicians. ||1|| 6

1430 : 47 In the second family is Maalakausak, 1430 : 48 who brings his five Raaginis: 1430 : 49 Gondakaree and Dayv Gandhaaree, 1430 : 50 the voices of Gandhaaree and Seehutee, 1430 : 51 and the fifth song of Dhanaasaree. 1430 : 52 This chain of Maalakausak brings along : 1430 : 53 Maaroo, Masta−ang and Mayvaaraa, 1430 : 54 Prabal, Chandakausak, 1430 : 55 Khau, Khat and Bauraanad singing. 1430 : 56 These are the eight sons of Maalakausak. ||1|| Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 002 7

1430 : 57 Then comes Hindol with his five wives and eight sons; 1430 : 58 it rises in waves when the sweet−voiced chorus sings. ||1|| 1430 : 59 There come Taylangee and Darvakaree; 1430 : 60 Basantee and Sandoor follow; 1430 : 61 then Aheeree, the finest of women. 1430 : 62 These five wives come together. 1430 : 63 The sons: Surmaanand and Bhaaskar come, 1430 : 64 Chandrabinb and Mangalan follow. 1430 : 65 Sarasbaan and Binodaa then come, 1430 : 66 and the thrilling songs of Basant and Kamodaa. Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 002 8

1430 : 67 These are the eight sons I have listed. 1430 : 68 Then comes the turn of Deepak. ||1|| 1430 : 69 Kachhaylee, Patamanjaree and Todee are sung; 1430 : 70 Kaamodee and Goojaree accompany Deepak. ||1|| 1430 : 71 Kaalankaa, Kuntal and Raamaa, 1430 : 72 Kamalakusam and Champak are their names; 1430 : 73 Gauraa, Kaanaraa and Kaylaanaa; 1430 : 74 these are the eight sons of Deepak. ||1|| 1430 : 75 All join together and sing Siree Raag, 1430 : 76 which is accompanied by its five wives.: Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 002 9

1430 : 77 Bairaaree and Karnaatee, 1430 : 78 the songs of Gawree and Aasaavaree; 1430 : 79 then follows Sindhavee. 1430 : 80 These are the five wives of Siree Raag. ||1|| 1430 : 81 Saaloo, Saarang, Saagaraa, Gond and Gambheer 1430 : 82 − the eight sons of Siree Raag include Gund, Kumb and Hameer. ||1|| 1430 : 83 In the sixth place, Maygh Raag is sung, 1430 : 84 with its five wives in accompaniment: 1430 : 85 Sorat'h, Gond, and the melody of Malaaree; 1430 : 86 then the harmonies of Aasaa are sung. Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 002 10

1430 : 87 And finally comes the high tone Soohau. 1430 : 88 These are the five with Maygh Raag. ||1|| 1430 : 89 Bairaadhar, Gajadhar, Kaydaaraa, 1430 : 90 Jabaleedhar, Nat and Jaladhaaraa. 1430 : 91 Then come the songs of Shankar and Shi−aamaa. 1430 : 92 These are the names of the sons of Maygh Raag. ||1|| 1430 : 93 So all together, they sing the six Raagas and the thirty Raaginis, 1430 : 94 and all the forty−eight sons of the Raagas. ||1||1|| 1430 : 95 Mundaavanee, Fifth Mehl &Raag Maalaa − Part 002 11
